Body:
#EAM --- Dusty

Current Status: Awaiting Client

Current Tier: T2 Support

Contact last comment: I did talk to the DBAs and we have made some changes to reduce the size of the data we retain. We are also moving around some schedules to prevent overloading the tempdb. 10/17

T2 Andy: Requested to Schedule Meeting 10/22
What We've Learned Updated: Schedules appear to be in conflict with each other.
Next Steps Updated: Adjust scheduled jobs to avoid conflict causing Out of Mem issue. Waiting for customer to schedule.

Next Steps Updated: Adjust scheduled jobs to avoid conflict causing Out of Mem issue. Waiting for customer to schedule.

Need to understand as to why there are interrupts (where/are these from NEA or 3rd party) during the bulk import, Support is aware that if the NEA jobs do not complete correctly the database tempdb will not clear out which will result in the SQL host running out of disk space.

email from customer:

 

 

Hi Andy,

 

I have adjusted the schedules to the best of my ability to address the conflicts. That has been about 80% successful

 

The cause of the incomplete jobs is usually due to Database maintenance or Server patching that usually occurs Monthly over the weekend. I have started disabling any jobs from running during the maintenance windows to address this issues. But it can be tough to manage because sometimes jobs run unexpectedly long and may run into the maintenance window

 

This was not an issue previously, because an interrupted job would still run successfully the next time around, if the job was interrupted during processing. However that is no longer the case now. Now it will not run successfully again until the bulk import job is rerun successfully first and then the schedule will run properly from that point on.

 

I will schedule some time, but I am out the rest of this week and with Thanksgiving next week we might be looking at early December.

 

Thanks

Peter Sterianos

Sr. Information Security Analyst

Cyber & Information Security

Peter.Sterianos@point32health.org

Office: (781) 612-4322

Cell: (781) 760-1153

@Andy Muschlewski​ @Tay Caliguiri​ 

Is Peter's perception of interrupted scans not requiring a bulk import in previous version correct?

 

Does this need to go to R&D?

 

"This was not an issue previously, because an interrupted job would still run successfully the next time around, if the job was interrupted during processing. However that is no longer the case now. Now it will not run successfully again until the bulk import job is rerun successfully first and then the schedule will run properly from that point on."
